name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: It’s breathtaking that after a year of working to prevent us from responding to COVID-19, Republicans would rather keep playing politics with our economic recovery than invest $1 billion into our state’s economy and support communities in their own districts.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The quickest way we can get back to normal and bounce back from this pandemic is by getting vaccinated. Kids ages 12-15 are now eligible to get the #COVID19 vaccine, so parents, don't wait—get the COVID-19 vaccine to protect your family and community.  https://t.co/PcwsARVmSO

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: It’s time for Republican leadership to put politics aside, and let's work together to invest in our economic recovery and development so we can bounce back from COVID-19 stronger, healthier, and better than we were before this pandemic hit.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Millions of people in the United States have received #COVID19 vaccines with many reporting only mild side effects. Watch Dr. Westergaard explain how the COVID-19 vaccine was developed to ensure they're safe and effective.  https://t.co/K8drR0mC57

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Mental health is important every day regardless of the month, but this Mental Health Awareness Month is especially important as we recover from COVID-19. I'll keep fighting to make sure mental health support is part of our economic recovery. #MentalHealthMatters  https://t.co/FIvV6uRiFP

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Big news! Wisconsin leads the nation in getting available shots in arms. One-third of Wisconsinites have now completed their COVID-19 vaccine series!  If you haven't gotten your shot yet, find a vaccine provider near you today:  https://t.co/B9lmuFZIN1  https://t.co/vQheQlFrKt

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We're investing our #AmericanRescuePlan funds in our small businesses and economic recovery and also in making sure we kick this pandemic to the curb with COVID-19 testing and vaccinations statewide. Let's get this done and bounce back, together.  https://t.co/SJFprAKNtk

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We’re working hard to make sure we can bounce back from COVID-19 and better off than we were before the pandemic hit. This deal is not the end of our work. I'm proud of the work that’s been done to get here and know we'll keep working to build an economy that works for everyone.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As folks get their #COVID19 vaccines, we can all see a light at the end of the tunnel, but we have to stay vigilant as COVID-19 cases rise across the country. That means keep wearing masks, getting your vaccine, and staying safe to save lives.  https://t.co/5oYaWOuwgK

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today, I joined @WI_DSPS Secretary-designee Crim on a tour of the Pfizer facility in Pleasant Prairie and signed AB 120, which will help Pfizer and our entire state continue to provide COVID-19 vaccine, vaccination materials, and solutions nationwide.  https://t.co/7p6kjuQPry

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Great news, folks! More than two million Wisconsinites have now received a dose of COVID-19 vaccine, or about 35% of our population. If you haven't yet, find a provider and make an appointment to get vaccinated today!  https://t.co/B9lmuFI7or  https://t.co/gEmvaBKNfc

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Kathy and I are excited to announce that Wisconsin has been selected to work with @NatlGovsAssoc on strategies for equitably meeting the social-emotional needs of students and families during and beyond COVID-19, including receiving grant funding to support this important work.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Starting today, @AlliantECenter will become Wisconsin’s third federal #COVID-19 vaccination site thanks to support from @fema. With this federal support, the Alliant Energy Center will now be able to vaccinate as many as 1,400 folks a day.  https://t.co/0wx4AwIIBI

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Starting today, ALL Wisconsinites over the age of 16 are now eligible to receive the #COVID19 vaccine. Find out how and where to get the COVID-19 vaccine by visiting @DHSWI ⬇️  https://t.co/mhjWpB8vug

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Our fight against COVID-19 isn’t over—while we work to get folks vaccinated as quickly as we can, we know wearing a mask saves lives, and we still need Wisconsinites to mask up so we can beat this virus and bounce back from this pandemic.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Folks, I know that we're all excited the #COVID19 vaccine is here, but we're not out of the woods yet. COVID-19 is still a serious threat, so keep wearing your masks, following state health guidelines, and get vaccinated as soon as you're eligible.  https://t.co/3u7PrxHOK2

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Our fight against #COVID19 isn't over yet. But today, we have something to celebrate: 1,000,000 Wisconsinites have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19. This wouldn't have been possible without the incredible work of our healthcare and frontline workers.   On, Wisconsin!  https://t.co/wKg47ZgNw2

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Economic recovery and opportunity are key to our state's success as we bounce back from #COVID19. Our #BadgerBounceback agenda puts families, farmers and small businesses in the best position possible to recover from COVID-19, and I know we can get it done by working together.  https://t.co/HtnpGLzgjb

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: All educators, education support staff, and childcare workers are now eligible for the #COVID19 vaccine. For more info on eligibility and where you can get a COVID-19 vaccine in your community, visit @DHSWI ➡️  https://t.co/gKcCRb0Y9J  https://t.co/QeJ2sov4uf

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@DHSWI has launched another tool to help keep you and your family up-to-date on #COVID19. Call their toll-free number for key info on COVID-19, how to find vaccine providers in your community, how to schedule COVID-19 vaccine appointments, and more ⬇️  https://t.co/mhjWpB8vug

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I was glad to tour the Manitowoc County Community #COVID19 Vaccination Clinic at the Expo Center to see the good work they're doing to get shots in folks' arms. It's important efforts like this that are making our state one of the top leaders for COVID-19 vaccine distribution.  https://t.co/GKJytQk2dy

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Folks, if you're eligible for a #COVID19 vaccine, be sure to check out @DHSWI's new map of COVID-19 vaccine providers to find a vaccine provider near you ⬇️  https://t.co/B9lmuFZIN1

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Need a #COVID19 test? You can request an at-home COVID-19 testing kit from the safety and comfort of your living room! Visit @DHSWI to learn more about how to request a testing kit ⬇️  https://t.co/jwuGrxlN38

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@DHSWI launched a new tool to help connect Wisconsinites with their local #COVID19 vaccine provider. If you're eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine, find a vaccine provider in your community ⬇  https://t.co/B9lmuFZIN1

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Need a #COVID19 test? Request a COVID-19 testing kit from your living room! COVID-19 saliva collection kits are available through @DHSWI for everyone who lives in Wisconsin, with or without symptoms, at no cost.  Learn more here⬇️  https://t.co/jwuGrxlN38

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: A few weeks ago, I proudly expressed my support for a COVID-19 bill the Senate passed almost unanimously and with bipartisan support—I said I would sign it if it came to my desk. Well, Wisconsinites know a compromise when they see one, and the bill that was passed today isn’t it.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We know that as we work to get shots in arms as quickly as we have vaccines available, no amount of vaccine in the world could bring back the lives we stand to lose if we have no statewide mitigation strategy in place to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in Wisconsin.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: COVID-19 has only underscored how important access to reliable, high-speed internet is for our communities. That's why I declared 2021 the Year of Broadband Access, and it's why my budget will invest roughly $200M into broadband across our state.  https://t.co/2vQEcfzhjf

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Although it's not the COVID compromise we originally proposed, AB 1 as amended by the Senate is a good start to support our state’s response to this pandemic. The Assembly should pass AB 1 as it was amended today and send it to my desk for my signature without delay.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I’ve been grateful to work together with Republican Majority Leader @SenatorDevin to find common ground and pass a bill on COVID-19 that reflects a good faith effort in compromise and bipartisanship.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I dedicate tonight’s #WISOTS to the more than 5,000 Wisconsinites who lost their lives to COVID-19. They were firefighters, healthcare workers, nuns, educators, students, veterans, moms and dads, sisters and brothers, friends and coworkers. They are loved and missed by many.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: This week, @WI_Guard administered their one millionth #COVID19 test. This milestone further exemplifies the absolutely vital role the Wisconsin National Guard has played in our state’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Folks, we added a new tool to our #COVID19 testing toolbox last week. Wisconsinites are now able to request at-home COVID-19 saliva collection kits, which are available whether you have symptoms or not and at no cost. Request a test today⬇️   https://t.co/jwuGrxlN38

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: It has been 264 days since the Legislature has passed a bill, and frankly, it would be inexplicable for any other topic to be taken up prior to passing one that addresses our most pressing needs for our COVID-19 response—especially one on which we’ve already found common ground.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: In partnership with @DHSWI, I am excited to announce a new tool to the Wisconsin #COVID19 testing toolbox: beginning TODAY, at-home COVID-19 saliva collection kits will be available to everyone who lives in Wisconsin, with or without symptoms, at no cost.  https://t.co/Ixb1W6Qfna

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today I introduced a compromise COVID-19 bill and wrote to Republican leaders calling for immediate action on this legislation so we can continue our state's response to this pandemic. We cannot afford to wait. I hope this legislation is taken up expeditiously and without delay.  https://t.co/PX0jHj6oMk

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Wisconsin citizens deserve the vaccine the federal government promised. Our healthcare workers and long-term care residents need this vaccine that is ready and available. We call on the federal government to send us more #COVID vaccine without delay.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: This is great news. I know we're all excited and relieved to see #COVID vaccines being distributed—I am, too. But remember, we have to stay vigilant by wearing masks and practicing social distancing while we keep fighting this virus.  https://t.co/5qSYYvxc3j

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us today for the latest updates on our COVID-19 response.   Tune in live at 1:30 pm here ⬇️  https://t.co/Bg3M6Ffo9P

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As we continue to move through the holiday season, we must be as vigilant as ever that we are taking every precaution to stop the spread of this virus.   Tune in to our live media briefing with @DHSWI at 1:30 p.m. today for updates on the state’s COVID-19 response ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Please consider donating blood or plasma to provide some help and hope to our most vulnerable COVID-19 patients. The need continues to be urgent. Donate at @BloodCenterWI or @RedCrossBloodBH today.     https://t.co/fp2KtOKPdL

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: From promoting general health and wellness in our communities to enduring the extraordinary challenges they have faced this year with COVID-19, we owe public health a great debt of gratitude. #PublicHealthThankYouDay  https://t.co/e0ld349qY8

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: These are heartbreaking stories of just a few of the 3,005 Wisconsinites who have lost the battle against COVID-19. We are thinking about their loved ones. Please stay home and stay safe. #StayHomeSaveLives    https://t.co/wNCnnFAxBF

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As we tackle the COVID-19 pandemic and its effects on Wisconsinites across our state, I am grateful for the good people that live here that work together to connect the dots and take care of our communities and neighbors.  https://t.co/ie5WkNWIR7

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today we reported 92 of our fellow Wisconsinites have passed away from COVID-19. 92 people who were somebody’s best friend, mother, father, co-worker, or neighbor. Our thoughts are with their loved ones. Please, Wisconsin, don’t risk it. Stay home. Stay safe. Save lives.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: This week we announced two of Wisconsin’s largest hunger relief organizations will receive an additional $10 million to help serve Wisconsinites experiencing food insecurity during the COVID-19 pandemic. More on the announcement below.    https://t.co/yKckrVD7hK

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Wisconsinites are helpers by nature and one way you can help is by donating blood and plasma. If you have recovered from COVID-19, your plasma can help treat our most vulnerable patients. Learn more  ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: On Tuesday night, I delivered a statewide address on the state of the COVID-19 pandemic in Wisconsin. This crisis is urgent and our situation is dire.   Watch below ⬇️   https://t.co/x86ONbJg55

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: There isn’t an industry or business that hasn’t felt the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. These funds are headed to 385 arts and cultural organizations that play a critical role in our local communities and our state’s economy.     https://t.co/CRbIsvlvIN

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Congratulations @SenBewley, Sen. Ringhand, @GordonHintz, @RepHesselbein, @SpeakerVos, and @RepSteineke on your elections to legislative leadership. I look forward to working together to fight COVID-19 and support Wisconsin businesses, workers, and families.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: In the coming days, I’ll be announcing a package of COVID-19 legislation that should be passed quickly to make sure we have the resources ready for those who need it.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: If you have been exposed to COVID-19, get tested. Then make sure you’re quarantining at home while you wait for your results. It’s important to remember that just because you test negative today doesn’t guarantee a negative test tomorrow. Please stay home.  https://t.co/laWnWV8GBs

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Unfortunately, they won’t be the last. The Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation estimates 5,000 Wisconsinites could be lost to COVID-19 by New Year’s Day if no further actions are taken to get this virus under control. That means another 2,500 who might not be with us.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: This spring, we took steps to contain COVID-19 by issuing a safer at home order. We estimated then that our efforts would save 300-1,400 lives. Unfortunately, that order was struck down by the State Supreme Court—a decision that hamstrung our ability to respond to this virus.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Now, as we put the election behind us, we are called upon to remember the things that unite us and that includes the struggles that we share. We must return our undivided attention to the COVID-19 pandemic. We must start fighting this virus, together, and we must start tonight.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Tonight I will address Wisconsinites and talk about our fight against COVID-19 and moving forward as one state with one goal—putting COVID-19 behind us.   Join me live at 6:05 p.m. here on my Facebook page or below ⬇️ #StayHomeSaveLives    https://t.co/RGEM0eASxg

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: In the last 7 days we have seen 282 friends, family members, and loved ones die from COVID-19. Our hearts and thoughts are with their families. Don’t risk it—stay home as much as you are able and help protect your fellow Wisconsinites.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today’s decision comes as we reported more than 6,000 new COVID-19 cases—the most ever in a single day. This is another blow to our state's response to this pandemic and our efforts to keep Wisconsinites safe.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Thank you, @SenFitzgerald and @SenatorRoth, for your service in Senate leadership. Congratulations to @SenatorDevin and @SenatorKapenga--I look forward to working with you on a plan for our state’s response to the COVID-19 pandemic and support for our state's economic recovery.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Make no mistake about it—this is an urgent crisis in our state and we are in a nightmare scenario. Last weekend we surpassed 2,000 deaths from COVID-19 statewide, with 2,156 deaths as of today.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Unfortunately, today, Wisconsin saw another record setting day with 5,935 new positive cases of COVID-19. It’s not happening someplace else or to somebody else. It’s here and Wisconsinites in every corner of our state know firsthand the tragedies this virus and pandemic hold.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: While I know the election is on everyone’s minds, the COVID-19 pandemic has not gone away. Join us at 1:30 pm for our live media briefing today as we provide updates on the state’s pandemic response. Live at 1:30 here ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We announced a $10 million investment for nonprofit organizations providing critical services. COVID-19 has affected families across our state in nearly every aspect of their lives and these organizations have been there every step of the way.  More here⬇️  https://t.co/QTt4Yq51lq

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us at 1:30 pm this afternoon for our live media briefing. I will join @DHSWI to provide the latest updates on COVID-19. We need to get back to the basics of fighting this virus, together.    Tune in here ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As you head out this weekend to run essential errands or get some fresh air, don’t forget to grab your mask and keep your distance from others. The best thing we can do for our COVID-19-positive friends, family, and neighbors is take every precaution to #StopTheSpread.  https://t.co/mFfil8BuIZ

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today Wisconsin saw the highest single-day COVID-19 death count with an additional 48 Wisconsin lives lost and a patient has been admitted to the alternate care facility at State Fair Park.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: You can also find a our breakdown on the COVID-19 Response and Recovery Investment dashboard, available below. The website provides regularly updated, transparent information regarding how and where we are investing these funds.     https://t.co/CeRnJRMel1

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We know that the COVID-19 pandemic has affected Wisconsinites in every corner of our state. Learn more about how our federal CARES funds are being used to fight the pandemic and support families, farmers, and small businesses who need it most, here⬇️   https://t.co/yFQoTn7HJ7

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I am proud of the work @WHEDAadvantage and Executive Director Altoro have done to serve Wisconsinites, even as COVID-19 has brought new housing challenges. Joaquín’s focus on equity and expanding opportunity is vital and this is well-deserved recognition.   https://t.co/BSZBdPU7eO

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today, I sent a letter to Republicans about our state’s response to COVID-19. One thing is certain: now is not the time to weaken our state’s response to this virus; now is the time to strengthen it.   You can read the full letter here ⬇️  https://t.co/JsXCDhWnIY

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As the number of COVID-19 cases in Wisconsin reached 150,000 yesterday, we will continue doing everything we can to prevent the spread of this virus.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today’s ruling is a victory in our fight against COVID-19 and our efforts to keep the people of Wisconsin safe and healthy during this unprecedented crisis.    https://t.co/NpQ1djnAuG

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I want to thank the many frontline healthcare workers and first responders who are caring for our most vulnerable COVID-19 patients and I urge everyone to help these folks by staying home as much as possible so we can flatten the curve, prevent hospitalizations, and save lives.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Unfortunately, today, we announced that we have received a request to open that facility as our healthcare systems are becoming overwhelmed by the surge of COVID-19 cases, especially in the Fox Valley and northern regions of our state.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Wisconsin has become one of the country’s hot spots for COVID-19. We have to get this virus under control, and we need to take further action to help stop the spread of this virus and flatten the curve.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Thank you to the leaders in @CalumetCounty, @cityofappleton, Menasha, @CountyOutagamie, and Winnebago County who did just that by using the data dashboard to issue a public health emergency COVID-19 alert to protect Wisconsinites.     https://t.co/boe3gqWGmL

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We are back again today for the second briefing this week because I am concerned about the alarming rise in COVID-19 cases that we’re seeing across our state.   Join us at 1:30 pm live here ⬇️   https://t.co/RMDf4tcoRQ

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: COVID-19 is not slowing down. We have to get this virus under control, and we cannot do that if folks continue to go about their lives as usual. We need Wisconsinites to wear a mask if they have to go out, but right now, the bottom line is that we need folks to stay home.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: My previous public health emergency remains in effect as we continue to address the COVID-19 pandemic. You can find a copy of my new public health emergency and face coverings order here ⬇️   https://t.co/xtjl6usxwR

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: With the start of the school year, we are now facing near-exponential spread of COVID-19. This is driven in part by the unprecedented number of infections among 18-24 year-olds, which have a case rate five times higher than any other age group.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We are facing a new and dangerous phase of the COVID-19 pandemic here in Wisconsin. We are seeing an alarming increase in cases across our state, especially on campuses. This is serious and we need your help.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The @WI_Guard is always ready to serve and not just Wisconsin but wherever they are called. In addition to their good work here helping with our COVID-19 response, the Wisconsin National Guard is now helping the firefighting efforts in California.     https://t.co/RcIYbdKrZK

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us at 1:30 pm today for our media briefing on the latest COVID-19 updates and hear directly from the folks at @DHSWI.    Tune in live here ⬇️  https://t.co/NYxQvH4LHS

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic has underscored how critical healthcare coverage is for every Wisconsinite. Due to the FEMA declaration of a national emergency for the pandemic, the special enrollment period for anyone who lost their healthcare coverage in the last year has been extended.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Wisconsin’s tourism industry is critical to the economic success of our state and it’s been hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic. @WIDeptTourism and I announced today that $8 million of CARES funding will be going to TRAVEL grants to help bolster this important industry.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As Wisconsinites, we’re all connected—by our health, by our actions, and by our commitment to each other. Please continue to stay home as much as you are able, wear a mask, and avoid gatherings to help protect yourself, your family, and your neighbors from COVID-19.  https://t.co/dXZ7kcQlwL

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Wisconsin workers have carried our state throughout the COVID-19 pandemic, adapting to new challenges to serve our communities. Today we celebrate their resiliency and reflect on the labor movement—past and present—that keeps our state strong. Happy #LaborDay, Wisconsin!  https://t.co/793vZ7dwsq

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us at 1:30 pm today for our live media briefing with @DHSWI as we provide updates on the COVID-19 pandemic in Wisconsin.    Tune in here ⬇️  https://t.co/RMDf4tcoRQ

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Wisconsin workers continue to face financial burdens and stress due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and we are working hard to ensure folks across the state are able to access the support they need.   https://t.co/Fb4wNDfqQQ

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Every corner of our state and every industry has been affected by COVID-19. That’s why we are investing our federal CARES funding where it is needed most. Learn more about these investments at:   https://t.co/CeRnJRuCWr.  https://t.co/72BD8Caz4J

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Testing is key to protecting you, your family, and your community from further spread of this virus. If you are experiencing symptoms or may have had contact with someone who has COVID-19, call your healthcare provider or find a community testing site at:  https://t.co/zHAfzUzuY0.  https://t.co/utOsNyLp4E

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We often think about COVID-19 in numbers, but these lives are far more than a statistic. Kathy and I send our deepest condolences to these families and the countless families, friends, and communities who are struggling with the loss of a loved one.  https://t.co/SiAejnQblt

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We have invested $1.72 billion of CARES funding into initiatives to support our COVID-19 response, schools, farmers, small businesses, and families. Learn more about how those funds are helping your local community with our new dashboard at:  https://t.co/CeRnJRuCWr.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us at 1:30 pm for our live media briefing for updates on our COVID-19 response efforts.   Tune in live at the link below ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@SenatorBaldwin is right—we can’t afford to have to ration healthcare or supplies in responding to COVID-19. Testing is a critical part of our state’s response to this pandemic, and we need access to these supplies to continue these important efforts.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Even one death from COVID-19 is one too many. To all the Wisconsinites dealing with the loss of a family member, a friend, a coworker, or a neighbor, I express my deepest condolences.   https://t.co/qmI2yWXNvW

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic has taken a toll on every Wisconsin household, whether physically, financially, or mentally and emotionally. These funds will be critical to ensuring folks have access to critical resources immediately.      https://t.co/3PSL4tAVrP

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: COVID-19 doesn’t take a break on the weekends. Continue to follow best practices so you can enjoy the weekend safely. #MaskUpWisconsin #StopTheSpread  https://t.co/AwyJNEzhNq

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 990 Wisconsinites have loss their battle against COVID-19. Folks, no barbecue or party is worth it. I know it’s tough, but every time you stay home or you wear a mask, you could be saving a life. That’s worth it. #MaskUpWisconsin  https://t.co/gDSH907nHb

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The @WI_Guard has played a critical role in our response to the COVID-19 pandemic and this mission is no different. The Guard has stepped up once again to help their neighbors, friends, and communities, by helping to ensure that every Wisconsinite can vote safely.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: This virus doesn’t care if you are a Democrat or a Republican and it certainly doesn’t care about any town, city, or county boundary. Every region of our state is seeing high COVID-19 spread, so let’s work together statewide to stop the spread. #MaskUpWisconsin  https://t.co/ASf8FChF08

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Folks, we need to work together to slow the spread of COVID-19 in our communities. If you have questions about the statewide face covering requirement going into effect on Saturday, check out the FAQ document available here:  https://t.co/nOe139JWQP  https://t.co/ltAwcCvL4B

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The @WI_Guard has played a critical role in responding to COVID-19. Our statewide testing efforts in communities across Wisconsin would be severely hindered without their continued support.    https://t.co/DNwx39njwa

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: This is another tool in the toolbox in reducing the spread of COVID-19, and the sooner we work together to box in this virus, the sooner we can get back to work, school, sports, restaurants, and get our state and our economy back on the right track.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Our healthcare providers, local public health officials, and those on the frontlines have been quarterbacking the  COVID-19 response, but it is on all of us to ensure our public health efforts are successful. Wear a mask, stay home, and continue to follow @DHSWI recommendations.  https://t.co/ZWlPUWj78i

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Even during the COVID-19 pandemic, farmers have never stopped working to ensure that folks have food on their tables and shelves in stores are stocked. This won't cover all the impacts our farmers have faced, but farmers have always had our back and we have to have theirs.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us at 1:30 pm today for a live update on the COVID-19 pandemic and the state’s continued response.   Tune in here ➡️  https://t.co/vzBxnkbK4V

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: This proactive step will put our state in a stronger position to weather revenue impacts from the COVID-19 pandemic, while also ensuring critical services remain accessible for Wisconsinites.   More on this announcement here:   https://t.co/QFzzKQK2V6

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I said previously that there isn’t a community, business, or family that hasn’t felt the economic impacts of COVID-19— our state government is no different. So today we announced an additional $250 million in spending cuts for this fiscal year.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We have seen record daily increases in positive COVID-19 cases in the last week. Don’t risk it. Look out for your loved ones, neighbors, and community by taking precautions to keep people safe. #StopTheSpread #MaskUpWisconsin  https://t.co/cigbHBYe3W

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us today at 1:30 pm as we provide an update on COVID-19 in Wisconsin. Tune in live at the link below ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today we announced our new Task Force on Broadband Access. As folks have adapted to COVID-19 by working, going to school, or visiting with their doctor from home, this pandemic has only underscored that access to reliable, high-speed broadband is not a luxury, it’s a necessity.  https://t.co/AhO0uPK9N2

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: All of us have a role to play in preventing the spread of COVID-19 and looking out for our neighbors, especially the folks disproportionately impacted by this deadly virus. Stay home, wear a mask when out, and don't risk it.     https://t.co/HB6X8TkFu9

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As @WEDCNews Secretary Missy Hughes says: every community, every person, and every business has been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, but Wisconsinites are resilient and we will continue to work to ensure our state bounces back together.    https://t.co/Db0xV10CJn

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Whether it's a school, cheese plant, or restaurant, we are doing everything we can to ensure folks have the resources they need to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Learn more about @ReadyWisconsin's work to distribute PPE statewide here:  https://t.co/Iwv3ytnOBf

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us at 1:30 pm today for our live media briefing for an update on COVID-19 in Wisconsin. ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Celebrating July 4th shouldn’t put families, friends, and neighbors at risk. COVID-19 has not gone away, folks—it is still very present and spreading in our communities. Don’t risk it. Stay home, practice social distancing, and always wear a mask.  https://t.co/dLkWiOwb6P

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Public health is everyone’s issue and overcoming COVID-19 is on every community, every age group, and every Wisconsinite. Let’s do this together, Wisconsin.  https://t.co/MKL76K1ERw

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Continue to monitor yourself for symptoms of COVID-19, and if you have any symptoms or you’ve recently been in a large gathering of people, please find a testing site near you to get tested at:  https://t.co/VsT2Z7rbLo.  https://t.co/O97TPc1XA2

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: COVID-19 is still very present and spreading in our communities. So, folks, don’t risk it. Please continue to follow best practices to keep yourself and your neighbors healthy and safe.  https://t.co/Io1pzCRjoC

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Stay updated on COVID-19 in your community by using @DHSWI new data dashboard. This dashboard can help you determine the risk of infection in your community and make informed choices for you and your family. Visit:  https://t.co/YbehRZTKfU  https://t.co/Q4qsVpltmN

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: These are just a few of the efforts the SEOC has championed to respond to COVID-19 and keep Wisconsinites safe. Learn more about the SEOC’s work over the last 100 days here:  https://t.co/uHFEqA40Pu

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The SEOC also took early and continued action to ensure healthcare workers and facilities had the resources, beds, ventilators, and PPE supplies they need to care for patients and tackle COVID-19.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: And in order to make sure our testing efforts were meaningful, we also had to make sure we bolstered our contact tracing efforts. So to date, we’ve conducted more than 9,000 disease and contact investigations to help contain the spread of COVID-19 in Wisconsin.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The SEOC took our lab capacity from the ability to perform 0 COVID-19 tests in early March to the capacity to perform 17,668 tests daily. As of yesterday, we’ve tested 491,702 people in Wisconsin.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: June 21st marked the 100th day that the State Emergency Operations Center has been activated for the COVID-19 pandemic response. This is the longest continuous activation in state history, and boy, have the folks at SEOC and our partners accomplished a lot in that time.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: If you’ve been out in large groups, it’s possible you’ve been exposed to COVID-19.  Here’s what you can do:   ➡️Contact your doctor and ask to be tested  ➡️Take the online assessment at the link below ➡️Find a community testing site near you:  https://t.co/VsT2Z79AmO

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Whether it is COVID-19 or maternal and infant health, we have to get to work addressing the health disparities faced by Black Wisconsinites. One of the answers is right in front of us: Medicaid expansion.  https://t.co/j3Wr0LD9OD

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@wi_revenue  and @widatcp launched our $50 million Wisconsin Farm Support Program this week providing direct payments to Wisconsin farmers during the COVID-19 pandemic.   Wisconsin farmers can apply here:  https://t.co/kLf5Mk6f92.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today we announced more than $80 million in financial assistance for our K-12 schools and higher education institutions to help alleviate the burden on our schools and prepare for the future as we continue to fight COVID-19. More details available here:   https://t.co/xkQCJqzlYv

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: June Dairy Month is a proud tradition in our state and there’s no better way to start the summer than by eating plenty of curds and ice cream to support our farmers and Ag. industry.   We’re America’s Dairyland, and that’s one thing COVID-19 won’t change.  https://t.co/5gKmLY1OQf

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Earlier this week, @WisDCF awarded just over $32 million to 2,367 early care and education providers through the Child Care Counts: COVID-19 Emergency Payment Program. The second application period is open through June 19.   To apply visit:  https://t.co/VpYFZ7C4Rz.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The Routes to Recover Grants will provide reimbursements for unbudgeted expenditures incurred this year because of the COVID-19 pandemic.  For more information, including the allocation amounts for counties and municipalities, visit:  https://t.co/KtMd1ZuNO0

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: And finally we have to ensure that our hospital systems and communities are prepared to handle a surge of COVID-19 patients over the summer and fall, because at this time, there is no standard treatment or vaccine for #COVID19.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Deadly viruses don’t go away on their own and they don’t go away because the Supreme Court tells them to. COVID-19 is still spreading in our communities. Don’t risk it. Stay safe, stay healthy, and stay home. #WIStaysHome  https://t.co/waEHMnUPcJ

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We recognize the burden the COVID-19 response has had on our long-term care facilities, home and community-based services, and emergency medical services and the integral role they play in ensuring the health and safety of some of our most vulnerable Wisconsinites.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We know that folks have been hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, both emotionally and financially. Making sure you have a roof over your head should be the last thing on your mind.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Join us now for our live briefing as we discuss the We're All In grant initiative and updates on the state's response to COVID-19. Link below ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Happy #MothersDay to all the moms and mother-figures out there! While COVID-19 has brought new challenges and some chaos into our lives and households, today we take a moment to appreciate all you do.  https://t.co/AQ04YBQarY

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: COVID-19 is still present and spreading through our communities. If we turn the dial too soon or too fast, we will undo the good progress we have made. Let’s move Wisconsin forward, folks, by staying home and staying safe. #SaferAtHome     https://t.co/OPs4QdhGWe

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Versiti @BloodCenterWI is doing important research related to using convalescent plasma to treat patients with COVID-19. If you had #COVID19 and have since recovered, learn more about donating at  https://t.co/1wLDAam7Kg.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The state has been working hard to support local health departments and we’re pleased to announce additional community testing events in NW Wisconsin. I urge anyone who is experiencing any symptoms of COVID-19 to go get tested at one of these events.  https://t.co/0fUDK3RFFB  https://t.co/qkDY3lJA5Z

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Staying home and limiting physical contact between people is the best strategy to slow the spread of COVID-19. #SaferAtHome is working and saving lives.  #COVID19 #StayHome  https://t.co/2zbepdephu

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@DHSWI and Riverside Corporate Wellness have developed a tool for easy and confidential #COVID19 screening. If you are feeling sick or experiencing COVID-19 symptoms, get connected to a medical professional safely and from home by visiting  https://t.co/w0TJbYh3Ox.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: What’s more is that $5 from every bobblehead purchase is going to the American Hospital Association’s Protect the Heroes campaign so I want to thank the folks at the @BobbleheadHall for joining in the fight against COVID-19 and supporting our frontline healthcare workers.

mentions.name: national bobblehead hall of fame and museum

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Apparently, instead of having us act quickly and decisively to respond to a crisis, Republicans would rather have us jump through hoop after hoop and ask for their permission to save lives. Folks, we don’t have time. COVID-19 will not wait.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today legislative Republicans told the 4,600+ people in the state of Wisconsin who have contracted COVID-19 and the families of the 242 people who have died, we don’t care about you -- we care about our political power.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Wisconsinites have had to make enormous sacrifices to slow the spread of COVID-19, but we are resilient and we will bounce back. #BadgerBounceBack

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Additionally, the state will continue to pursue every avenue to grow Wisconsin’s supply of personal protective equipment #PPE for healthcare and public safety entities to conduct COVID-19 testing, patient care, and public safety work.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: A few weeks ago, we had a pretty grim outlook for what COVID-19 could mean for our state, but safer at home is working, folks. Our data shows we have saved lives and we have helped flatten the curve, which has resulted in fewer cases and hospitalizations. #THREAD

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: COVID-19 presents significant challenges, but I’ve never doubted Wisconsinites’ resilience, empathy, or compassion. Reply 👇 and tell me your stories of the healthcare workers, first responders, neighbors, educators, businesses—you name it—who are stepping up to help.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Residents who are seeking a COVID-19 test are still required to receive an order from a doctor. These labs are not testing sites. 8/8

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The Wisconsin Clinical Lab Network labs have been averaging completion of 1,500-2,000 COVID-19 tests per day. The expanded capacity from the state’s new partnership is expected to double that capacity initially and continue to expand. 2/8

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: THREAD: Expanding Wisconsin’s testing capacity is a critical step in ensuring the health and safety of Wisconsinites. That’s why today we announced a new public-private partnership to increase Wisconsin's laboratory testing capacity for COVID-19. 1/8

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: In addition to our SNS shipments, we have also requested PPE from FEMA which is critically necessary to protect our first responders and health care workers who are on the front lines of the COVID-19 battle.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Please join @DHSWI and I live now at our 1:30 pm briefing on the COVID-19 public health emergency and our #SaferAtHome order.   Watch here:   https://t.co/z0LRB55L2S

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We’re all in this together, and each and every one of us has to do our part to help slow the spread of COVID-19 so we can #FlattenTheCurve to ensure our doctors, nurses, and healthcare workers have the opportunity to do their important work.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We also need folks to limit their interactions to the same people, not different small groups. Shrinking your circle of interactions will help prevent the spread of COVID-19. Unfortunately that means no sleepovers, no play dates, and no dinner parties with friends and neighbors.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Over the past few days, I’ve talked with public health experts and with business leaders and local elected officials around the state. Overwhelmingly the response I heard is that we need an all-hands-on-deck approach to stopping the spread of COVID-19 in Wisconsin.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As we’ve worked to respond to and prevent the spread of COVID-19, we've have been careful to listen to public health experts and to be mindful of the effects our proactive steps could and will have on our frontline workers and the most vulnerable in our communities.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: We have been working hard to ensure the health and safety of the people of our state as we have responded to COVID-19. We’ve taken important steps, but folks, time is of the essence. So today I’m announcing we'll be issuing a #SaferAtHome order tomorrow. Here’s what this means ⬇️

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As we continue to face challenges surrounding COVID-19, it is critically important that school district administrators, educators, students, and parents know we are working to address their concerns and to do what’s best for our kids, educators, and schools.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@DHSWI Secretary-designee Andrea Palm and I were live earlier to answer questions related to COVID-19 and provide some updates on our response.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: The @WI_Guard plays an important role in responding to the COVID-10 public health emergency. Watch Major General Knapp's message to learn more ➡️ https://t.co/cmI6qfMOPy

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 1/ Unfortunately, today, we confirmed the first two deaths from COVID-19 in our state. Our hearts go out to all the loved ones affected by these deaths, and to all those suffering from this virus. We are thinking of you during this difficult time. My full statement is below:  https://t.co/KfXUyqAeJS

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I have always said that Wisconsinites are helpers by nature. It’s in our DNA. If you are looking for ways you can help during these challenging times, check out the COVID-19 Response Initiative established by @WI_UnitedWays and @ServeWisconsin:  https://t.co/IGWSCWOEDA

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: While it is important to stay informed with the latest news regarding COVID-19, it can also cause a lot of fear, stress, and anxiety.   If you need to talk, support is available. Call @DistressLine at 1-800-985-5990 or text TalkWithUs to 66746. #NoStigma

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@LGMandelaBarnes and I wanted to take a moment to thank all of those working on the frontlines to keep our families and communities safe during COVID-19. Thank you.  https://t.co/lIvdeUc4Cr

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today we waived work search requirements and modified the availability requirements for unemployment insurance benefits. Ensuring workers who are impacted by closures due to COVID-19 are able to access these benefits is critically important. More here:  https://t.co/KeMztZrPr1

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@WisDCF is working to ensure that child care providers have the resources and supplies they need. If you are a child care provider who needs assistance during the COVID-19 public health emergency, contact DCF here:   https://t.co/nP171Jk0Lp

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: I requested federal financial assistance for Wisconsin businesses. COVID-19 is impacting even the best operators. As a state, we extend our promise to work with our federal and state officials to be a partner to you during these uncertain times. More here:  https://t.co/cxeNHjRlJv

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: A few moments ago, I announced that at 5pm tonight bars will be closed and restaurants will be take-out or delivery only statewide. Our top priority at this time is to keep Wisconsinites safe and healthy by reducing the spread of COVID-19, especially for those who are high-risk.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 2/2 For additional information on safety protocols, donation deferments and limiting the spread of COVID-19, visit/share:  https://t.co/fy5Pi6ZPBk

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Limiting gatherings to 50 people or less is another critical step forward in slowing the spread of COVID-19. I know this is hard for many communities, but keeping the public safe and healthy is our top priority.   More here:  https://t.co/zZo35IhveY

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: As part of our COVID-19 response, the Office of the Commissioner of Insurance has requested that health plan issuers be flexible on prescription drug supply limitations and early refill limitations.   Learn more at  https://t.co/hVZuDHEjlN.  https://t.co/CyWzrSglHP

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Folks, it’s on all of us to practice social distancing and take every step possible to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. That is why I have directed @DHSWI Secretary-designee Andrea Palm to order a ban on mass gatherings of 50 or more people. 1/3

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 1/3 Early this morning, the @WI_Guard helped 29 Wisconsinites who were aboard the Grand Princess cruise ship arrive home safely. As of today, none of the 29 have tested positive for COVID-19 and are not showing symptoms.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: .@WisconsinDPI is working diligently to ensure our kids have nutritious meals while schools are closed due to COVID-19 by applying for a waiver that allows them to send meals home to kids. More at:  https://t.co/KIEJZP8p9S

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Thank you to all the healthcare workers, direct care workers, public employees, and those on the frontlines for rising to the need of our communities during COVID-19. Your service to our state and communities is greatly appreciated.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Yesterday I sent a letter to @SenatorBaldwin and @SenRonJohnson asking for them to support bipartisan legislation to address the COVID-19 public health emergency.  https://t.co/bkQKsUz17b

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: On Thursday, I declared a public health emergency in Wisconsin relating to COVID-19 to make sure Wisconsin is proactive in slowing and preventing the spread of the virus.   Watch here:  https://t.co/Qm6Fp979fd.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Being mindful about using best practices, like washing your hands frequently and avoiding direct contact with others will help protect not only you, but your friends, family, and neighbors from the spread of COVID-19. #COVID19  https://t.co/eK9FDH2ThT

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Our state agencies are working diligently to ensure Wisconsinites are safe. @PSCWisconsin issued directives that no utility service is to be disconnected for nonpayment during the COVID-19 public health emergency.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Please continue to find the most accurate and up-to-date information on the status of COVID-19 in Wisconsin at  https://t.co/PqpXVWR3UR

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Closing our schools is not a decision I made lightly, but keeping our kids, our educators, our families, and our communities safe is a top priority as we continue to work to respond to and prevent further spread of COVID-19 in Wisconsin.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: Today, I directed @DHSWI to issue an agency order mandating the closure of all K-12 Wisconsin schools, public and private, as part of our efforts to respond to and contain the spread of COVID-19 in Wisconsin.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 2/2 We can all do our part to help prevent the spread of the illness to others. With the good work of folks at @DHSWI and your mindfulness, we can help reduce and slow the spread of COVID-19. We are all in this together.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 1/2 On March 12th, I declared a public health emergency to address the outbreak of COVID-19. This allows us to access state resources to deal with this pandemic head on, care for those who need it, and limit the spread of this virus.  https://t.co/zxOrSErBSc

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 4/ Our state agencies are doing good work to ensure that Wisconsin is prepared to prevent the spread of coronavirus. Last week the @wisconsinoci requested insurers to waive co-pays for COVID-19 testing.

name: Governor Tony Evers
tweet: 1/ This morning I declared a public health emergency in the state of Wisconsin related to COVID-19. This will allow @DHSWI and other state agencies to utilize every tool available to them to prevent the spread of coronavirus and protect public health.  https://t.co/EOOEqxAKpI
